comment: Smart data models - Transformer schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.S4BLDG/master/Transformer/schema.json
description: A transformer is an inductive stationary device that transfers electrical energy from one circuit to another.  Transformer is used to transform electric power; conversion of electric signals for other purposes is handled at other entities: Controller converts arbitrary signals, AudioVisualAppliance converts signals for audio or video streams, and CommunicationsAppliance converts signals for data or other communications usage.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: apparentPowerMax
contents.comment: Property. Maximum apparent power/capacity in VA (volt ampere). Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: hasManufacturer
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: hasModel
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: imaginaryImpedanceRatio
contents.comment: Property. The ratio between the imaginary part of the zero sequence impedance and the imaginary part of the positive impedance (i.e. imaginary part of the short-circuit voltage) of the transformer. Used for three-phase transformer which includes a N-conductor.

contents.name: isNeutralPrimaryTerminalAvailable
contents.comment: Property. An indication of whether the neutral point of the primary winding is available as a terminal (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

contents.name: isNeutralSecondaryTerminalAvailable
contents.comment: Property. An indication of whether the neutral point of the secondary winding is available as a terminal (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: primaryApparentPower
contents.comment: Property. The power in VA (volt ampere) that has been transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).

contents.name: primaryCurrent
contents.comment: Property. The current that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side. Usually measured in Ampere (A).

contents.name: primaryFrequency
contents.comment: Property. The frequency that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side. Usually measured in cycles/s or Hertz (Hz).

contents.name: primaryVoltage
contents.comment: Property. The voltage that is going to be transformed and that runs into the transformer on the primary side. Usually measured in Volts (V, W/A).

contents.name: realImpedanceRatio
contents.comment: Property. The ratio between the real part of the zero sequence impedance and the real part of the positive impedance (i.e. real part of the short-circuit voltage) of the transformer. Used for three-phase transformer which includes a N-conductor.

contents.name: secondaryApparentPower
contents.comment: Property. The power in VA (volt ampere) that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s).

contents.name: secondaryCurrent
contents.comment: Property. The current that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side. Usually measured in Ampere (A).

contents.name: secondaryCurrentType
contents.comment: Property. A list of the secondary current types that can result from transformer output.

contents.name: secondaryFrequency
contents.comment: Property. The frequency that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side. Usually measured in cycles/s or Hertz (Hz).

contents.name: secondaryVoltage
contents.comment: Property. The voltage that has been transformed and is running out of the transformer on the secondary side. Usually measured in Volts (V, W/A).

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: transformerVectorGroup
contents.comment: Property. List of the possible vector groups for the transformer from which that required may be set. Values in the enumeration list follow a standard international code where the first letter describes how the primary windings are connected, the second letter describes how the secondary windings are connected, and the numbers describe the rotation of voltages and currents from the primary to the secondary side in multiples of 30 degrees. D: means that the windings are delta-connected. Y: means that the win

contents.name: isSubSystemOf
contents.comment: Relationship. A reference to a system(s) that this Physical Object is part of.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
